page.title: 04EVENTS IN LITTLE CHALFONT
page.content: A man, aged 75, died in a car crash in April. He was driving up Stanley Hill, when it is thought he had a heart attack. He veered off the road and crashed through a fence. The woman passenger survived without any injuries. There was also a dog in the back which suffered from shock. The crash was at about 2.45.It was very near the time when the pupils of St. George's School would be leaving. Luckily no other pedestrians were involved. Two students from Amersham College have been chosen to speak in the Young Speaker of the Year Competition organized by the English Speaking Union to mark International Youth Year.The best six speakers will go before a panel of judges in November. A trophy and scholarship will be awarded to the winner.
